meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or development.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outpace any other animal in a race.
meanings.sent2: The new technology will outpace the old one in no time.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outpace him.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in learning the piano quickly outpaced her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The rocket's speed outpaced all expectations, reaching the moon in record time.

meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the marathon, Sarah managed to outpace her competitors.
meanings.sent2: The sports car was able to outpace the police cars in the chase.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outpace the cat in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The river's current seemed to outpace the speed of the boat.
meanings.sent5: The wind's force was so strong that it could outpace a running horse.

meanings.definition: To exceed or outstrip in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: In the sales competition, she always manages to outpace her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The company's growth continues to outpace its competitors in the market.
meanings.sent3: The race between the two friends to finish their homework first ended with one managing to outpace the other.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination to win allowed him to outpace his opponents in the final stretch.
meanings.sent5: The student's dedication to studying helped her outpace her classmates in academic achievements.
